newsitem.title: UK: S&P affirms R&C Holding, outlook stable.
newsitem.headline: S&P affirms R&C Holding, outlook stable.

text.p: Standard & Poor's said on Tuesday it affirmed its A plus senior unsecured debt rating of R&C Holding B.V.
"The long-term rating outlook is stable," S&P said in a statement.

At the same time, S&P affirmed its A1 commercial paper ratings of Reckitt & Colman Inc, Reckitt & Colman Canada Inc and Reckitt & Colman Plc and the A plus corporate credit rating of Reckitt & Colman Plc.
"The affirmation follows today's announcement that Reckitt is to pay an extraordinary, foreign income dividend of 152 million sterling, to be funded by cash, S&P said.

It said the rating action acknowledged the moderate size and limited, financial impact of this transaction on Reckitt's balance sheet and coverage ratios, as well as the group's strong discretionary cash flows exceeding !00 million sterling per year to restore financial strength quickly.

"Pro-forma for the extraordinary dividend, S&P estimates that Reckitt's 1996 net debt will be somewhat higher than expected at just over 700 million sterling, and funds from operations to net debt will decrease to about 35 percent," the statement said.
But the rating agency added that pretax net interest coverage should still exceed six times and said this was "satisfactory for the current rating."
